abstract: An object representing the span of time between a specific start date and end date.
overview:
## Overview

In Swift, this object bridges to [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/DateInterval]; use [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDateInterval] when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.

An `NSDateInterval` object represents a closed interval between two dates. The `NSDateInterval` class provides a programmatic interface for calculating the duration of a time interval and determining whether a date falls within it, as well as comparing date intervals and checking to see whether they intersect.

An `NSDateInterval` object consists of a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDateInterval/startDate] and an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDateInterval/endDate]. The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDateInterval/startDate] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDateInterval/endDate] of a date interval can be equal, in which case its [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDateInterval/duration] is `0`. However, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDateInterval/endDate] cannot occur earlier than [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDateInterval/startDate].

You can use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/DateIntervalFormatter] class to create string representations of `NSDateInterval` objects that are suitable for display in the current locale.

source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/Foundation/NSDateInterval

# NSDateInterval

**Class**

An object representing the span of time between a specific start date and end date.

## Declaration

```swift
class NSDateInterval
```

## Overview

In Swift, this object bridges to [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/DateInterval]; use [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDateInterval] when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.

An `NSDateInterval` object represents a closed interval between two dates. The `NSDateInterval` class provides a programmatic interface for calculating the duration of a time interval and determining whether a date falls within it, as well as comparing date intervals and checking to see whether they intersect.

An `NSDateInterval` object consists of a [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDateInterval/startDate] and an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDateInterval/endDate]. The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDateInterval/startDate] and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDateInterval/endDate] of a date interval can be equal, in which case its [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDateInterval/duration] is `0`. However, [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDateInterval/endDate] cannot occur earlier than [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSDateInterval/startDate].

You can use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/DateIntervalFormatter] class to create string representations of `NSDateInterval` objects that are suitable for display in the current locale.



## Creating Date Intervals

- **init()**: Initializes a date interval by setting the start and end date to the current date.
- **init(start:duration:)**: Initializes a date interval with a given start date and duration.
- **init(start:end:)**: Initializes a date interval from a given start date and end date.
- **init(coder:)**: Returns a date interval initialized from data in the given unarchiver.

## Accessing Start Date, End Date, and Duration

- **startDate**: The start date of the date interval.
- **endDate**: The end date of the date interval.
- **duration**: The duration of the date interval.

## Comparing Date Intervals

- **compare(_:)**: Compares the receiver with the specified date interval.
- **isEqual(to:)**: Indicates whether the receiver is equal to the specified date interval.

## Determining Intersections

- **intersects(_:)**: Indicates whether the receiver intersects with the specified date interval.
- **intersection(with:)**: Returns the intersection between the receiver and the specified date interval.

## Determining Whether a Date Occurs Within a Date Interval

- **contains(_:)**: Indicates whether the receiver contains the specified date.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
